alert.note: Alert for Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 4:15AM EST until February 26 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Belmont, Carroll, Guernsey, Harrison, Jefferson OH, Monroe, Noble and Tuscarawas. Portions of Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Allegheny, Armstrong, Beaver, Indiana, Washington and Westmoreland. Portions of the northern panhandle of West Virginia, including the following counties, Brooke, Hancock, Marshall and Ohio. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 413 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain across the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, Wheeling, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Moon Township, McMurray, Weirton, McKeesport, Steubenville, Washington, Franklin Park, Cambridge, Jeannette, Aliquippa, Moundsville and Canonsburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
